name: Play It Again
description:
Made as a game-a-week experiment.

by Isaque Sanches
http://twitter.com/l1x1v1a
https://www.facebook.com/l1x1v1a

-
"I had the idea for 'Play It Again' at a music concert.
It's a game about the human experience perceived from a non-human point of view.
At the concert for some reason I started thinking about cycles and the Aztec belief of eternal recurrence - how we go from progress to reactionarism, to progress again, and so on - how faith dominates and gets replaced by atheism, which gets replaced by faith again, and so on - how a generation is right wing, the next one becomes left wing, then the next right wing again, and so on.
Everything is in a cycle.
Humanity is like a clock. It constantly changes, but ultimately it doesn't change at all.
This is a game about that.
